entry.title: ZIP File of All MarkLogic Product Documentation

unnamed-group.entry: A zip file containing the latest MarkLogic Server documentation.

group.name: Getting Started Guides
group.guide: A quick, step-by-step overview of how to get up and running with MarkLogic Server.
Contains procedures for installing and upgrading MarkLogic Server on all platforms.
Contains a summary of new features, upgrade compatibility information, and other information about this release.

group.name: Developer's Guides
group.guide: Provides procedures, methodologies, and conceptual information about general application development tasks in MarkLogic Server.

Provides procedures, methodologies, and conceptual information about developing search-related applications in MarkLogic Server. Includes information about the Search API and the built-in search features of MarkLogic Server.
Provides step-by-step information on using the Application Builder to build a search application, and also provides information on customizing applications built with the Application Builder.
Provides step-by step information on using the Information Studio to load content into MarkLogic Server.
Contains an overview of the what you can do with the XCC libraries, examples of how to use XCC, and an overview of the sample applications included with XCC.
Provides a review of Hadoop terminology, a description of the MarkLogic-provided classes that enable data to be taken from or sent from MarkLogic, and an explanation of the sample code provided.

group.name: Administrator's Guides
group.guide: Provides procedures for administrative tasks such as creating servers, creating databases, backing up databases, creating users, setting up your security policy, and so on.
Provides information on writing code to script various administrative tasks such as creating and modifying databases, App Servers, and so on.
Provides a thorough explanation of how to configure and use MarkLogic database replication.
Provides step-by step information on replicating MarkLogic Server content.
The documentation for the MarkLogic Connector for SharePointÂ®, which allows you to mirror documents from a Microsoft SharePoint repository in MarkLogic Server.

group.name: Other Reference Guides
group.guide: A condensed overview of the XQuery language, including a description of the three XQuery dialects supported in MarkLogic Server. Also includes XSLT reference material, including details and extensions to the language. This book does includes some syntax information, although it is primarily intended as an introduction and quick-reference to the languages, not as a comprehensive reference.
Provides an introduction to the Content Processing Framework and procedures for installing the default content processing framework.
Description TBD...
Provides performance-related information that is useful to application developers and administrators.
Provides information on large-scale system architecture, clustering, and details on setting up both local-disk failover and shared-disk failover.
Provides information on the role-based security model in MarkLogic Server.
Provides information on using an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) of MarkLogic Server on Amazon EC2.
Provides a full description of Query Console features, user interface, administration, and differences between Query Console and CQ.

group.name: XCC API Reference
group.entry: API documentation for the MarkLogic XML Content Connector for Java (XCC/J) API.
API documentation for the MarkLogic XCC .NET C# API.
